name: Number of compositions of n such that any fixed point k can be k different colors.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2000
formula: G.f.: 1 + Sum_{i>0} Product_{j=1..i} ( j*x^j - x^j + x/(1-x) ).
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, add(
author: _John Tyler Rascoe_, Apr 18 2025

name: Number of compositions of n such that any part 1 can be k different colors where k is the current record having appeared in the composition.
comment: A record in a composition is a part that is greater than all parts before it, reading left to right. The first part of any non-empty composition is considered a record. A part 1 can be a record, iff it is the first part of a composition.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..600
example: b:= proc(n, m) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, add(
author: _John Tyler Rascoe_, Apr 21 2025
